Understanding cricket scoring and terminology is essential for following the game.

Basic Scoring:
• Single: 1 run (batsmen swap ends)
• Double: 2 runs
• Triple: 3 runs (rare)
• Boundary: 4 runs (ball reaches boundary)
• Six: 6 runs (ball crosses boundary in air)

Extras (Awarded to batting team):
• Wide: Ball bowled outside batter's reach (1 run + re-bowl)
• No-ball: Illegal delivery (1 run + free hit in limited overs)
• Bye: Runs scored without bat touching ball
• Leg-bye: Runs scored off body (not bat)
• Penalty: 5 runs for various infringements

Bowling Terms:
• Over: 6 legal deliveries by one bowler
• Maiden: Over with no runs scored
• Hat-trick: 3 wickets in 3 consecutive balls
• Yorker: Ball pitched at batsman's feet
• Bouncer: High, short-pitched delivery

Batting Terms:
• Duck: Batsman out for 0 runs
• Golden Duck: Out on first ball faced
• Century: 100 runs by one batsman
• Half-century: 50 runs by one batsman
• Double Century: 200+ runs

Common Abbreviations:
• LBW: Leg Before Wicket
• DRS: Decision Review System
• SR: Strike Rate (runs per 100 balls)
• RR: Run Rate (runs per over)
• RPO: Runs Per Over
